snippet: The New York Times’s staff scours the Web for interesting and peculiar items. Thursday’s selections include a report that the Gmail alternative used by Edward J. Snowden has decided to shut down rather than hand over information to investigators....
abstract: The New York Times’s staff scours the Web for interesting and peculiar items. Thursday’s selections include a report that the Gmail alternative used by Edward J. Snowden has decided to shut down rather than hand over information to investigators. Plus, eBay’s chief executive spoke about the fusion of e-commerce and retailing.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Snowden's E-Mail Service Shuts Down and the Future of E-Commerce
